decks.notes: The deck is focused on controlling the game through powerful counterspells and removal spells while utilizing the Gifts Ungiven card to search for key combo pieces. The deck aims to use Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide recurring value from the graveyard and maintain card advantage. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting opponents' strategies, the deck can set up powerful win conditions such as chaining multiple spells with Underworld Breach or overwhelming opponents with a Brain Freeze combo. Overall, the deck excels at outmaneuvering opponents and securing victory through careful planning and execution.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently controlling the board and drawing cards. It utilizes a combination of counter spells, removal, card draw, and efficient threats to maintain control of the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to constantly recur low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through attrition and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebears with disruptive abilities to slow down the opponent while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It aims to control the board with cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, while also utilizing powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for fast mana acceleration. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Void Mirror further disrupt the opponent's game plan, creating a challenging environment for them to navigate. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and control the game while setting up for a quick victory with aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through fast mana artifacts and spells like Moxen and Black Lotus. It aims to draw cards and dig for combo pieces with cards like Ancestral Recall and Merchant Scroll, eventually leading to a combo finish with Paradoxical Outcome and Brain Freeze or Chain of Vapor. The deck also runs disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo. The companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value and recursion from the sideboard.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and removal to control the game, while also utilizing card draw and tutoring to maintain card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slowly chip away at their resources until the player can establish a dominant position on the board. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recur key cards from the graveyard. The mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage tools make this deck a strong contender in a 1 vs 1 format.

This combo Dredge deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures, utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to set up explosive plays. By efficiently dredging cards from the graveyard, the deck can quickly bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Ichorid. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection against opposing disruption, while also allowing the deck to protect its combo pieces. The deck is designed for fast, explosive plays to overwhelm opponents and win the game through its graveyard synergy.

The key idea of this Esper Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing card advantage through powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck focuses on countering threats with cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion that provides additional value by allowing the player to recast low-cost creatures. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and card advantage to come out on top in the long run.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Control-Oath of Druids deck focuses on quickly getting out Atraxa, Grand Unifier using Oath of Druids and Forbidden Orchard, while also protecting the combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. Show and Tell can also help cheat out Atraxa or other key cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The deck runs disruptive cards like Null Rod and Stock Up to control the board while also having powerful card draw and tutoring with Ancestral Recall, Vampiric Tutor, and Demonic Tutor. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a dominant board presence.

The deck focuses on playing disruptive creatures that hinder your opponent's game plan while still being aggressive in nature. It uses hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down spells, combined with creature beatdown from creatures like Archon of Emeria and Clarion Conqueror. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration from fast mana sources like Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats. The goal is to disrupt your opponent's strategy while presenting a fast clock to close out the game.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on aggressive creatures that also disrupt the opponent's game plan with hate cards. By playing Hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck slows down the opponent's plays while also keeping up the pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. The mana base is streamlined to support the Hatebear strategy, and key cards like Cavern of Souls and Wasteland can further disrupt the opponent's plans. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while applying pressure with efficient creatures.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to slow down and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. By utilizing cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer, Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Additionally, hate cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere further hinder the opponent's ability to cast spells effectively. The mana base is streamlined for efficiency and consistency, allowing the deck to execute its game plan quickly and effectively.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources while utilizing powerful spells and interactions to gain card advantage and ultimately outvalue the opponent. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while setting up card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion, while cards like Dress Down and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade further disrupt opposing strategies. Ultimately, the deck aims to grind out wins through control and card advantage.

The deck focuses on using artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts to apply pressure to the opponent while also slowing down their game plan. By utilizing powerful mana sources like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, the deck can quickly deploy threats such as Stonecoil Serpent and Patchwork Automaton. The inclusion of cards like Nettlecyst and Mystic Forge allow the deck to generate additional value and advantage. Additionally, cards like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere make it difficult for the opponent to cast their spells efficiently, giving the aggro strategy an edge.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage, utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Ancestral Recall to control the game. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw, while also utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for extra value. With a mix of efficient removal, counterspells, and card advantage, this deck aims to grind out its opponents and control the game until it can secure a win.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to generate infinite mana using cards like Grim Monolith and Paradoxical Outcome, then use that mana to activate Coveted Jewel multiple times in a single turn. This allows the player to draw their entire deck, find specific combo pieces like Time Vault and Voltaic Key, and eventually win the game through various means such as taking extra turns with Time Walk or locking down the opponent's board with Sink into Stupor. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Mana Crypt provide additional protection and acceleration, making the deck a powerful and versatile combo archetype.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through Oath of Druids, which allows the player to cheat powerful creatures into play. It also includes various counterspells and disruption spells to protect the strategy. The deck can quickly ramp into its key cards with fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Mana Crypt. The inclusion of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional threats and manipulation abilities. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and win through powerful creatures and strategic plays.
